boardgame.name: Bazaar
Bier BÃ¶rse
Troca
boardgame.description: The components of Bazaar include a whole bunch of little chips, in five colors. At the start of the game, two equation cards are randomly chosen. Each equation card has five equations on it, for a total of ten equations that will be in effect for the duration of the game. The equations state equivalences between certain combinations of colors, for example:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Red = Green Green_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Green Yellow = Blue Blue Red_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Four target cards are turned up, each with some combination of five chips represented on the target card (so a typical target card might be Green Green Blue Blue Blue)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;On your turn, you roll a colored die to randomly pick a colored chip for yourself, or you can make one exchange of your colored chips based on the equations. The goal is to end up with the right combination of chips to get one of the target cards. You want to do this quickly _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; and even more importantly, with as few chips left over as possible after you've purchased the target card _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; because this is how you score points._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The original version is part of the 3M Bookshelf Series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Discovery Toys version. Missing 13 gems (some from each color). There still should be plenty of gems available for six players, but you have the chance of running out. Game is in good condition, with the box showing some shelf wear.
This game was a preorder.

BAZAAR 1987 Discovery Toys. I assume complete with instruction sheet, 10 barter cards, 45 merchandise cards, 4 star cards, 100 jewels (20 ea. clear, blue, red, yellow, green), 1 special wood die, 1 scoresheet pad. The bag of jewels is still in its unopened plastic bag and the cards are still cellophane sealed. All components are Brand New condition. Box has wear including creases and marks, but has kept the contents in perfect shape. Shipping weight is 3 pounds.

Discovery Toys edition. Cards still in their shrinkwrap, (although the shrink is torn off at one end). Box shows a small patch of tape/price tag tear on one side panel, and the same corner is starting to have the cover paper come off. Very minor in my opinion. This is the version with the glass beads. Pictures available upon request.

I am selling a Discovery Toys _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Special Edition_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; copy of Bazaar. It has been played a few times, but everything inside the box is in near mint condition. The outside of the box shows minor wear with the worst feature being a permanent marker mark on the front (I think everyone knows what that is from!) that is faded by me attempting to remove it using a dry erase marker. Anyway, we have enjoyed the plays we have had of Bazaar, but need to slim the collection down a bit. Comes from a smoke free/pet free environment. It looks just a bit less worn than this picture: http://www.boardgamegeek.com/image/54309 but gives you an idea of what my copy looks like. Shipping to anywhere in the U.S. is $14. The glass stones make this one a little heavy! Thanks for looking!

Some glass beads are missing, but these are very easily replaced to someone who knows his or her way around a craft store (not me). Shipping for games that will fit within a 13.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 11.75_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; X 3.25_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; box costs $10.70. I can easily combine shipping if games will fit within these boxes. If they don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t, I can still combine shipping, but that is a little tricker. Thursdays are the days I get most of my shipping done, if that helps you.

Gryphon Games (GRY 101308N) Through skillful trading and re-trading, each player attempts to gain the right combination of colored stones from the Bank to purchase the wares displayed in the Bazaar. Values of the various wares are determined by the number of stones the purchaser holds following his transaction. Trading is governed by the current rates posted at the Exchange. When all the wares from two of the stalls have been sold, the Bazaar is closed, the game ends, and the player with the highest score wins!
